thread.title: EU could ‘CRUMBLE’ after Brexit - German politician’s WARNING to Brussels
thread.title_full: EU could ‘CRUMBLE’ after Brexit - German politician’s WARNING to Brussels

title: EU could ‘CRUMBLE’ after Brexit - German politician’s WARNING to Brussels
text:
EU could ‘CRUMBLE’ after Brexit - German politician’s WARNING to Brussels EU could ‘CRUMBLE’ after Brexit - German politician’s WARNING to Brussels GERMANY cannot support the EU after Brexit and weaker countries should leave the single currency, according to a leading German MEP. PUBLISHED: 00:00, Thu, Feb 9, 2017 | UPDATED: 00:02, Thu, Feb 9, 2017 GETTY Beatrix von Storch believes the EU could crumble if the fiancial woes of member states continue 
Beatrix von Storch, vice chair for the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party, said Germany cannot afford to save the other struggling EU nations from impending financial doom. 
She said: “It’s not possible for Germany to rescue all of the rest of Europe by paying off the debts of Greece and next Italy and then Spain and in the end, France… that’s not possible. Related articles 
“Look at Greece, you leave Greece on its own it will collapse. 
“Greece should leave the euro, yes. The euro is too strong.” 
Ms von Storch has been a strong critic of the failing EU currency and claimed there is support among political parties across Europe to pull out of the single currency. GETTY Ms von Storch has long been a critic of the single currency 
She added: “I think there’s a basic line within all those parties which are now growing in several states, stating that we don’t want to give up our sovereignty and this is why we want to ask the people.” 
The euro is used by 19 of the 28 EU members with Germany being the largest economy to do so. A move back to a sovereign currency could spell the end for the bloc. It’s not possible for Germany to rescue all of the rest of Europe by paying off the debts of Greece and next Italy and then Spain and in the end, France… that’s not possible Beatrix von Storch 
However, Ms von Storch claimed it is up to the people to decide whether the EU should come to an end. 
She added: “If the whole thing crumbles because the people want it to crumble… then it should crumble.” 
It comes as French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen plans to urge European leaders to ditch the euro and return to national currencies if she wins the election in May, her chief economic adviser has claimed. EUROSCEPTICISM: These are the most eurosceptic countries Mon, January 16, 2017 EUROSCEPTICISM, meaning criticism of the European Union (EU). Rising disenchantment with the dealings of EU is not just confined to the UK.
